The concept of cycles is explained here: http://www.apple.com/batteries/. Apple says a battery should retain 80 percent of it health (not charge) after 300 cycles. I have a macbook 2,1 from around June 2007 (so around 3.5 years old) and I've used this machine every day since I had it. The full capacity of the (original) battery is currently around 4788mA after 975 charging cycles, and I get around 4.5 hours of browsing and general use (I'd get around 5 hours when it was new). Programming I get 2-3 hours depending on what I'm doing. The first battery of my Macbook black died after 2 years. Got replaced by apple.
